name: Take this More Mixed Trivia Quiz! Difficult Trivia | Mixed 10 Questions

questions.text: In the UK, when would you pay the tax called 'stamp duty'?
questions.explanation:
When you buy a house.

	You pay stamp duty if you buy a house.

questions.text: What was named the UK's top movie theme in BBC's 2013 vote?
questions.explanation:
'Star Wars'.

	'Star Wars' had 25% of the vote in 2013. Ennio Morricone's 'The Good, The Bad and the Ugly' was second.

questions.text: What would you do at London's 'Donmar Warehouse'?
questions.explanation:
See a show.

	See a show - the Donmar Warehouse is a theatre, specialising in cabaret and fringe theatre.

questions.text: From London, you can travel on Eurostar to Paris, Brussels and what other city?
questions.explanation:
Lille.

	Lille is where the Eurostar connects with other European lines before going on to Paris or Brussels.

Pushkin.

	It is a great tragic love story that has inspired opera and ballets.

questions.text: What is the fictional London borough featured in 'EastEnders'?
questions.explanation:
Walford.

	Walford is located somewhere between the real life East London boroughs of Tower Hamlets and Newham.

questions.text: In what field did Berthold Lubetkin make his name?
questions.explanation:
Architecture.

	Architecture - he pioneered modernist architecture in Britain.

questions.text: Who played Donnie Brasco in the movie of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Depp.

	Johnny Depp plays Donnie, although Al Pacino also stars in this gangster story.

questions.text: What nationality is former Manchester United goalkeeper, Fabien Barthez?
questions.explanation:
French.

	He was a French national team member.

questions.text: What is the Bolsa de Madrid?
questions.explanation:
Stock Exchange.

	The Bolsa is the Spanish Stock Exchange, like the Bourse in France.
